info.description:
HERE Tracking is a cloud product designed to address location tracking problems for a wide range of Location IoT industry verticals.

HERE Tracking exposes a set of REST APIs and client libraries to enable location tracking and geo-fencing for a variety of device form-factors including small-footprint (small memory and processing power) devices. HERE Tracking also includes end-user applications on mobile and web to be used as reference apps to demonstrate the product capabilities.
info.title: HERE Tracking

signedRequest.description:
HERE Tracking requires that you sign your requests for tokens. The signature method uses the OAuth 1.0 standard. For more information on this standard, see the [OAuth Core 1.0](https://oauth.net/core/1.0/) specification.

> **Note:** You must create a new signature for each token request to HERE Tracking. Signatures can only be used once.

Create the Signature Base String
---

The first step in creating a signature is to create the signature base string. This string contains the parameters to use when generating the signature.

*1. To begin, make sure you have the information listed in the following table.*

| Parameter                | Description                              |
| ------------------------ | -----------------------------------------|
| oauth\_consumer\_key     | The device ID for which you want to generate a token. |
| oauth\_signature\_method | Always use "HMAC-SHA256".                 |
| oauth\_timestamp         | The number of seconds since the Unix epoch at the point the request is generated. This must be within 10 seconds of the timestamp returned by the `/v2/timestamp` endpoint. |
| oauth\_nonce             | A unique string for this signature. The string cannot have been used in a previous signature. Each token generation request to HERE Tracking must have a unique signature, and the value in this parameter is what is used to ensure the signature is unique. |
| oauth\_version           | Always use "1.0".                         |

*2. Combine these values into a single string by following these steps:*

   1. URL encode every key and value.
   2. Sort the list of key-value pairs alphabetically by key.
   3. Concatenate each key/value pair, separating each with an ampersand character ("&").

The result is a parameter string that looks like this (line breaks are added for legibility):

   ```
   oauth_consumer_key=47164fb0-b7b3-49e8-891b-650270b82cf2
   &oauth_nonce=LIIpk4
   &oauth_signature_method=HMAC-SHA256
   &oauth_timestamp=1513634609
   &oauth_version=1.0
   ```

*3. Combine the HTTP method, base URL, and parameter string into a single string called the "base string". This will be the string from which the signature is generated. The base string is in this format:*

   ```
   POST&https://tracking.api.here.com/v2/token&<URL encoded parameter string>
   ```

   The base string consists of:

   1. The HTTP method in caps (POST) followed by an ampersand ("&")
   2. The URL of the HERE Tracking token endpoint followed by an ampersand ("&")
   3. The URL-encoded parameter string.

   For example (line breaks are added for legibility):

   ```
   POST
    &https%3A%2F%2Ftracking.api.here.com%2Fv2%2Ftoken
    &oauth_consumer_key%3D47164fb0-b7b3-49e8-891b-650270b82cf2%26
    oauth_nonce%3DLIIpk4%26oauth_signature_method%3DHMAC-SHA256%26
    oauth_timestamp%3D1513634609%26oauth_version%3D1.0
   ```

   > **Note:** The URL-encoded base string should contain exactly two ampersands ("&").

Create the signature
---

The signing key used to sign the base string is the `deviceSecret` followed by an ampersand ("&").

Create the signature by passing the signature base string and the signing key to the `HMAC-SHA256` hashing algorithm and converting the result to a `base64` string. Then, use the signature to request a token.

Request the token
---

Make a `POST` request to this endpoint with an `Authorization` header constructed from the above parameters and the generated signature.

Example:

```
    Authorization: OAuth oauth_consumer_key="47164fb0-b7b3-49e8-891b-650270b82cf2",
        oauth_signature_method="HMAC-SHA256",
        oauth_timestamp="1513634609",
        oauth_nonce="LIIpk4",
        oauth_version="1.0",
        oauth_signature="pQ9EJX14L736B%2Br7uZl4yQlO6Xw%3D"
```
signedRequest.name: Authorization

tags.description: Manage associations between devices and other resources.
tags.name: Device Associations

tags.description:
This service is used to manage the associations between devices and geofences.

HERE Tracking generates a notification when a device crosses into or out of an associated geofence.
tags.name: Geofence association

tags.description:
Create and manage geofences.

A geofence is a geographic boundary that you can define and associate with your
devices. HERE Tracking can then notify you when a device transitions into or out
of a geofence.
tags.name: Geofences

tags.description:
Data ingestion over HTTPS. This is the only interface that devices use
to communicate with HERE Tracking.
tags.name: Ingestion

tags.description:
Manage notification channels for a user and trigger an 'instant update' to a device.

Users can opt to receive notifications whenever one of their devices transitions
into or out of a geofence. The channel supported for notifications is webhook.

Webhook
---

Once a user has registered a URL as a webhook, that URL will receive a POST request
every time a transition happens.

The POST body is a JSON object that describes the transition.

```
{
    "inOut": "PING_OUTSIDE_FENCE",
    "fenceId": "{ID of geofence}",
    "deviceId": "{ID of device that transitioned}",
    "timestamp": 1499258184142,
    "notificationStatus": "SENT"
}
```

Possible values for `inOut` are:

 * PING_OUTSIDE_FENCE
 * PING_IN_FENCE

 Offline
 ---

 If a device has been working offline and caching position updates, transition
 notifications aren't sent until the device is online again. Once the device is
 online, the user receives a notification for the latest transition only.

 This behavior prevents the user from receiving a batch of out-of-date notifications
 whenever their device goes back online. However, all transitions are still recorded
 in the transitions log.
tags.name: Notifications

tags.description: The Registry is used to create credentials for a device manufacturer and for a claiming a device to a user.
tags.name: Registry

tags.description:
Shadows provide an effective way to manage configurations for devices that are only
intermittently online.

Shadows are stored in HERE Tracking and contain two states of a device's
configuration: The `reported` state and the `desired` state.

The `reported` state contains the settings that were sent when the device was last
online.

The `desired` state contains the settings that will be sent to the device when the
device next comes online.

> **IMPORTANT**
> Devices should not communicate directly with this service but should instead send telemetry
> to the ingestion endpoint only. This telemetry data is used to update the `reported`
> configuration for the device.

Ideally, applications should only write to the `desired` configuration state and
only read from `reported` configuration state.
tags.name: Shadows

tags.description:
Use this API to access current and historical data that a device has collected.
This data includes a history of the device position, payload, and timestamp.

> **IMPORTANT**
> Devices should not communicate directly with this service but should instead send telemetry
> to the ingestion endpoint only.
tags.name: Traces

tags.description:
Use this API to access current and historical data about device transitions.

A transition event is created every time a device enters or exists an associated
geofence. These events are stored in the transition log.

This log also includes details of events where a device 'almost' crossed a geofence
boundary. Device positions determined through GPS, WiFi or other methods have a range
of uncertainty about them. This uncertainty is represented as a radius around the
recorded point showing the accuracy of the position.

These are times when the accuracy radius reported around a device interesects with
the geofence boundary but where it is not possible to confirm what side of the
geofence boundary the device is on. This returns those events as well as total transitions.
tags.name: Transitions

shadow.description: The data that Shadows persists for each device.

desired.description: The currently desired state of the device.

payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

system.description:
Contains values for the device configuration. HERE Tracking uses these values
for various application flows.

Unlike the payload object, HERE Tracking reads the contents of the system object.

rate.description: This can be used to specify the rates at which the device performs certain tasks.

distanceM.description: The device should send an update if it moves more than this distance in meters

sampleMs.description: The rate at which to sample signals in milliseconds

sendMs.description: The rate at which to send sample results in milliseconds

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

The time of the last update to the desired state. This is set by HERE Tracking
when an update is written to the desired state.

reported.description: The last known state reported by the device.

payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

id.description: The building id

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

name.description: The building name

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

system.description:
Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

This object can be read by HERE Tracking whereas the content of the payload is
opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

homenetwork.description: Information about subscriber home network - 3GPP MCC+MNC or 3GPP2 SID+NID. Dual-SIM devices can provide information on both two subscriptions.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

This describes when the reported measurements were taken.

If the device does not provide a timestamp, Here Tracking writes its own system time
here at ingestion time.

trackingId.description: The ID HERE Tracking assigned to the device when it was claimed by a user.

Deletes all geofences created by the provided user account.

As an extra safety measure, you must also supply the header `x-confirm`
with the value `true`. If this header is not explicitly specified on a
**Delete All** request, the request fails.

put.description:
Claim a device to a user. Before a device is claimed, it cannot complete
login and any data sent to the ingestion endpoint will be ignored. Once a
device is claimed, its data is stored and available to its owner.

When a device is claimed, it will be assigned a trackingID. This is the
identifier in HERE Tracking that the data is associated with. Having a
separate deviceId and trackingId means that devices can have their ownership
transferred without having to create and install a new deviceId and
deviceSecret.

post.description:
Provides shadow objects for multiple devices. You can get shadows for a
maximum of 20 devices per request.

parameters.description:
ID used for correlating requests within HERE Tracking. Used for logging and error reporting.

Must be a valid UUIDv4.
parameters.name: x-request-id

items.description: The HERE Account ID of a user.

200.description:
Successful

The response contains a list of shadow objects that are each
contained inside a body object and accompanied by a statusCode.

If there's an error, each trackingId has a separate status code:

 * 403 - Forbidden
 * 404 - Device not found

body.description: The data that Shadows persists for each device.

desired.description: The currently desired state of the device.

payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

system.description:
Contains values for the device configuration. HERE Tracking uses these values
for various application flows.

Unlike the payload object, HERE Tracking reads the contents of the system object.

rate.description: This can be used to specify the rates at which the device performs certain tasks.

distanceM.description: The device should send an update if it moves more than this distance in meters

sampleMs.description: The rate at which to sample signals in milliseconds

sendMs.description: The rate at which to send sample results in milliseconds

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

The time of the last update to the desired state. This is set by HERE Tracking
when an update is written to the desired state.

reported.description: The last known state reported by the device.

payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

id.description: The building id

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

name.description: The building name

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

system.description:
Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

This object can be read by HERE Tracking whereas the content of the payload is
opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

homenetwork.description: Information about subscriber home network - 3GPP MCC+MNC or 3GPP2 SID+NID. Dual-SIM devices can provide information on both two subscriptions.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

This describes when the reported measurements were taken.

If the device does not provide a timestamp, Here Tracking writes its own system time
here at ingestion time.

put.description:
Updates the device shadow that is stored in HERE Tracking.

The device shadow contains 'reported' and 'desired' configuration states
for a device.

Request
---

The body is a shadow object with either an update to the `desired` or
`reported` configuration state.

You cannot use the same request to update the `desired` and `reported`
properties simultaneously. Instead, use separate requests for each type of
configuration state.

Response
---

The response body is a shadow object that shows the difference between the
`reported` and the `desired` states. It contains properties that don't
match across the two configurations.

The response example shows the response to the previous request example
where the `desired` state was updated.

If all `reported` and `desired` properties match, the response object
contains only the trackingId and timestamp properties.

parameters.description:
The size of the shadow in bytes. The size is validated against the maximum
limit of 1000 bytes.
parameters.name: content-length

current system time is always used.

get.description:
Gets the value for a single property in the given state. You can use
JSON selectors to select values for `desired` or `reported` properties.
You can also reference a property by name, but if the property contains
an object, the entire object is returned rather than a distinct value.

The JSON selector can be nested like this: `payload/time/minutes`

200.description:
Successful

The content type is defined as "text/plain" or "application/json"
depending on the type of the property.

Response to a request for the 'color' property which has the type
'string'.

```
Content-Type: text/plain
red
```

Requested property is a position object
```
Content-Type: application/json
{
    "alt": "105",
    "accuracy": "18",
    "lng": "13.38480101",
    "lat": "52.5308544",
```

get.description:
Gets all traces that were recorded within the specified time range.

Define the range with "before" and "after" timestamps. A successful
response contains an array of traces that were recorded after the
first timestamp and before the second.

Traces are returned as an array in descending order based on timestamp.

Note:
---

To ensure a fast response, always provide both `before` and `after` timestamps.

If no values are supplied `after` defaults to 0, and `before` defaults
to the current system time.

The `count` and `pageToken` parameters provide pagination for results
where a large volume of data matches the given time range.


In this case, `count` is the number of records returned per page along with
a `pageToken` header in the returned HTTP response. The `pageToken` indicates
the next available page in the matching result set. To get the next page of
records, submit `pageToken` as a query parameter in your next request. The default
number of records per page is 1000, which is also the maximum number of
records per page.

In case of success, the response body contains an array of trace
samples between the given timestamps (after <= timestamp <= before).

parameters.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
The accepted range is from 1 to the current time.
parameters.name: before

parameters.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
The accepted range is from 0 to the current time.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A page token that you can use to retrieve the next page.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: The number of records per page.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description:
If you set this to "true", the trace sample is passed through a Kalman smoothing filter.
The default is `false`.
parameters.name: filter

200.description:
Successful.

The response body contains an array of trace samples between the
given timestamps (after <= timestamp <= before).

Trace samples are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

get.description:
Gets all transitions that were recorded within a specific time range. This
log also includes events when the accuracy radius of the reported position
intersects with a geofence boundary.

You define the range with `before` and `after` timestamps. A successful
response contains an array of transitions that were recorded after the
first timestamp and before the second.

Transitions are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

Note:
---

To ensure a fast response, always provide both `before` and `after` timestamps.

If no values are supplied `after` defaults to 0, and `before` defaults
to the current system time.

The `count` and `pageToken` parameters provide pagination for results
where a large volume of data matches the given time range.

In this case, `count` is the number of records returned per page along with
a `pageToken` header in the returned HTTP response. The `pageToken` indicates
the next available page in the matching result set. To get the next page of
records, submit `pageToken` as a query parameter in your next request. The default
number of records per page is 1000, which is also the maximum number of
records per page.

200.description:
Successful

The response body contains an array of transitions, a count
and a pageToken if available.

If no transitions are found, an object with empty data array is
provided.

Transitions are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

count.description: The number of items to return per page.

pageToken.description: A page token that you can use to retrieve the next page.

items.description:
| Transition Type          | Meaning                                  |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------- |
| PING_OUTSIDE_FENCE       | The device has transitioned fully outside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_IN_FENCE            | The device has transitioned fully inside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_NEAR_FENCE_BOUNDARY | The accuracy circle intersects the geofence. |

trackingId.description: The ID HERE Tracking assigned to the device when it was claimed by a user.

schema.description:
The response body contains an array of transitions, a count and a
pageToken if available.

If no transitions are found, an object with an empty data array is provided.

Transitions are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

If notifications were enabled for the given `trackingId` and `geofenceId` pair at
the time the transition happened, a notification was sent and the `notificationStatus`
recorded in the transition history was 'SENT'.

post.description:
A device uses its access token to send data to HERE Tracking.

If the request is set to be synchronous, the response will be
the desired state of the device shadow. If the request is set
to be asynchronous, the response will be empty.

To have a position associated with a device, the request body must contain
either a `position` or a `scan` object (see the object definitions for
details). If both are provided, the `scan` is resolved to a `position`. The
more accurate of the two positions (provided and resolved) is used as the
device's position.

If a `scan` is provided, HERE Tracking will resolve the position asynchronously
and return the desired state. The shadow will then be updated
immediately after responding.

parameters.description:
ID used for correlating requests within HERE Tracking. Used for logging and error reporting.

Must be a valid UUIDv4.
parameters.name: x-request-id

parameters.description: If set to true, sends the device's data and responds immediately with an empty response body.
parameters.name: async

An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

name.description: The building name

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

scan.description: Radio measurements used for positioning or radio map contribution.

items.description: Bluetooth measurement. In addition to rss, one of mac, eddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

eddystoneId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 10-byte Namespace component and a 6-byte Instance component

iBeaconId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 16-byte UUID + 2-byte major + 2-byte minor

mac.description: The MAC address of the Bluetooth access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single Bluetooth AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching WLAN or Bluetooth access point. Either MAC, EddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

rss.description: Received signal strength (dBm) at the terminal

channel.description: CDMA channel frequency (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pnoffset)

pilotpower.description: Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

pnoffset.description: Pseudonoise offset (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for channel)

country.description: Indicates in which country the WLAN APs are located (in case cell data is not present in radio_observations)

gps.description:
Optionally supply this to improve HERE Tracking's positioning service by
contributing the scan data along with a GPS position.

system.description:
Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

This object can be read by HERE Tracking whereas the content of the payload is
opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

homenetwork.description: Information about subscriber home network - 3GPP MCC+MNC or 3GPP2 SID+NID. Dual-SIM devices can provide information on both two subscriptions.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

This describes when the reported measurements were taken.

If the device does not provide a timestamp, Here Tracking writes its own system time
here at ingestion time.

200.description:
Successful

The device data was ingested, processed and the desired state was returned.

Returned if the `async` query parameter is not set or is set to anything other than `true`.

204.description:
Successful (no content)

The device data was ingested but the response does not contain the latest shadow.

This message is sent when the `async` query parameter was set to `true`.

400.description:
Bad request

The request object is in an incorrect format or has values that are invalid or out of range.

If available, further error details are provided in the response body.

example.message: The request object is in an incorrect format or has values that are invalid or out of range.

details.description: An optional object containing more information about the error

id.description: An error ID that allows you to trace the error details

message.description: Descriptive text that explains the error

Unauthorized

The request did not provide correct authentication details

message.description: Descriptive text that explains the error

details.description: An optional object containing more information about the error

id.description: An error ID that allows you to trace the error details

message.description: Descriptive text that explains the error

429.description:
> **Note:** Based on plan configured with your appId, the device will be rate limited.

When device exceeds the number of requests allowed in plan configured with the appId, it will receive Too Many Requests 429 error code along with following headers

| header                    | description                               |
| ------------------------  | ----------------------------------------- |
| X-RateLimit-Remaining     | The remaining number of requests          |
| X-RateLimit-Limit         | The allowed number of requests for the device's appId plan |
| Retry-After               | The number of seconds the device needs to wait before retrying to send |

example.message: Too Many Requests

details.description: An optional object containing more information about the error

id.description: An error ID that allows you to trace the error details

message.description: Descriptive text that explains the error

OK

The service is performing as expected

Service unavailable

post.description:
HERE Tracking requires that you sign your requests for tokens.
The signature method uses the OAuth 1.0 standard. For more
information on this standard, see the [OAuth Core
1.0](https://oauth.net/core/1.0/) specification.

> See the Authentication section for details on how to generate a signed token request.

401.description:
*Timestamp wrong*

When the request timestamp is more than 10 seconds skewed from the
server time, the `x-here-timestamp` header with the current server
timestamp is added to the response.

*Incorrect Signature*

If the OAuth signature is incorrect, the response will be a 401 but
*without* the `x-here-timestamp` field.

current system time is always used.

you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

system.description:
Contains values for the device configuration. HERE Tracking uses these values
for various application flows.

Unlike the payload object, HERE Tracking reads the contents of the system object.

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pathloss). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

ta.description: Timing advance (Optional). Round-Trip distance presented in the units of 4*c/7.68e6 ~156 meters. That is, the scaling factor is 4 times the chip length at chip rate of 7.68 Mchips/s. Note that at chip rates 1.28 Mchips/s and 3.84 Mchips/s you need to scale according to chip length of 7.68 Mchips/s, that is, multiply by 6 or 2 if needed.

uarfcn.description: Carrier frequency of a UTRA-TDD Serving Cell (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for cellparams).

cid.description: UTRAN Cell Identifier, 28 bits (12 bits RNC and 16 bits Cell id). Mcc+mnc+cid uniquely identifies the WCDMA cell, lac is optional.

nmr.description: Network measurements (Optional). Maximum of 8 uarfcndl times maximum of 32 psc.

cid.description: UTRAN Cell Identifier (uc-id) (Optional)

psc.description: Primary Scrambling Code (Primary CPICH, Primary Control Pilot Channel)

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

uarfcndl.description: Downlink frequency of a UTRA-FDD Serving Cell

psc.description: Primary Scrambling Code (Primary CPICH, Primary Control Pilot Channel) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for uarfcndl).

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

uarfcndl.description: Downlink frequency of a UTRA-FDD Serving Cell (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for psc).

band.description: Frequency range (GHz). Allowed values are 2.4, 3.65, and 5. (Possible future values include 4.9, 5.9, 60, and 900.)

mac.description: The MAC address of the WLAN access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. Note that if the SSID contains postfix "_nomap", the AP should not be used for positioning. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single WLAN AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching wlan or cell.

powrx.description: Received signal level (dBm) at the terminal (Optional)

Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:

here at ingestion time.

An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

id.description: The building id

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

name.description: The building name

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

count.description: The count of created licenses for given appId

jobId.description: ID identifying this job. Retain for future use. Valid for 24 hours after {now}.

id.description: Must be a valid UUIDv4.

count.description: The number of items to return per page.

pageToken.description: A page token that you can use to retrieve the next page.

items.description: A JSON object containing the newly created device credentials

deviceSecret.description: The newly created device secret. Valid credentials are the combination of a secret and ID

percent.description: The percentage of the job that was completed at the time of the request.

status.description: The status of the requested job. May be "started" or "complete". When status is "complete", results may be downloaded.

responseTraces.description:
The response body contains an array of trace samples, count and pageToken, if
available.

If no trace samples are found, an object with an empty data array is returned.

Trace samples are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

count.description: The number of items to return per page.

pageToken.description: A page token that you can use to retrieve the next page.

items.description:
| Transition Type          | Meaning                                  |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------- |
| PING_OUTSIDE_FENCE       | The device has transitioned fully outside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_IN_FENCE            | The device has transitioned fully inside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_NEAR_FENCE_BOUNDARY | The accuracy circle intersects the geofence. |

trackingId.description: The ID HERE Tracking assigned to the device when it was claimed by a user.

responseTransitions.description:
The response body contains an array of transitions, a count and a
pageToken if available.

If no transitions are found, an object with an empty data array is provided.

Transitions are listed in descending order based on the timestamp.

If notifications were enabled for the given `trackingId` and `geofenceId` pair at
the time the transition happened, a notification was sent and the `notificationStatus`
recorded in the transition history was 'SENT'.

scan.description: Radio measurements used for positioning or radio map contribution.

items.description: Bluetooth measurement. In addition to rss, one of mac, eddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

eddystoneId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 10-byte Namespace component and a 6-byte Instance component

iBeaconId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 16-byte UUID + 2-byte major + 2-byte minor

mac.description: The MAC address of the Bluetooth access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single Bluetooth AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching WLAN or Bluetooth access point. Either MAC, EddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

rss.description: Received signal strength (dBm) at the terminal

channel.description: CDMA channel frequency (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pnoffset)

pilotpower.description: Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

pnoffset.description: Pseudonoise offset (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for channel)

country.description: Indicates in which country the WLAN APs are located (in case cell data is not present in radio_observations)

gps.description:
Optionally supply this to improve HERE Tracking's positioning service by
contributing the scan data along with a GPS position.

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

bcch.description: Broadcast Control Channel (Synonymous to ARFCN = Absolute Radio Frequency Channel) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bsic).

bsic.description: Base Station Identity Code (for instance, color code) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bcch).

cid.description: Cell Identifier, 16 bits. Mcc+mnc+lac+cid uniquely identifies the GSM cell.

bcch.description: Broadcast Control Channel (Synonymous to ARFCN = Absolute Radio Frequency Channel)

bsic.description: Base Station Identity Code (for instance, color code)

cid.description: Cell Identifier (Optional)

rxlevel.description: Received Signal power (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -110dBm should be mapped to -110. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.
Received Signal power (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -110dBm should be mapped to -110. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

ta.description: Timing advance (Optional). Expressed in the units of GSM bits equaling to 48/13 Î¼s ~ 1107 meters.

cid.description: E-UTRA Cell Identifier, 28 bits (20 bits eNodeB and 8 bits Cell id). Mcc+mnc+cid uniquely identifies the LTE cell, tac is optional.

earfcn.description: Evolved Absolute Radio Frequency Channel (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pci)

cid.description: E-UTRA Cell Identifier (Optional)

rsrp.description: Reference Signal Received Power = RSRP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rsrq). Power less than -140dBm should be mapped to -140. Power greater than -44dBm should be mapped to -44.

rsrq.description: Reference Signal Received Quality = RSRQ (dB) (Optional). Values less than -19.5dB should be mapped to -19.5, and values greater than -3dB should be mapped to -3dB.

pci.description: Physical Cell Identity (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for earfcn)

rsrp.description: Reference Signal Received Power = RSRP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rsrq). Power less than -140dBm should be mapped to -140. Power greater than -44dBm should be mapped to -44.

rsrq.description: Reference Signal Received Quality = RSRQ (dB) (Optional). Values less than -19.5dB should be mapped to -19.5, and values greater than -3dB should be mapped to -3dB.

band.description: Frequency range (GHz). Allowed values are 2.4, 3.65, and 5. (Possible future values include 4.9, 5.9, 60, and 900.)

mac.description: The MAC address of the WLAN access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. Note that if the SSID contains postfix "_nomap", the AP should not be used for positioning. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single WLAN AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching wlan or cell.

payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

id.description: The building id

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

name.description: The building name

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

scan.description: Radio measurements used for positioning or radio map contribution.

items.description: Bluetooth measurement. In addition to rss, one of mac, eddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

eddystoneId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 10-byte Namespace component and a 6-byte Instance component

iBeaconId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 16-byte UUID + 2-byte major + 2-byte minor

mac.description: The MAC address of the Bluetooth access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single Bluetooth AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching WLAN or Bluetooth access point. Either MAC, EddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

rss.description: Received signal strength (dBm) at the terminal

channel.description: CDMA channel frequency (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pnoffset)

pilotpower.description: Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

pnoffset.description: Pseudonoise offset (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for channel)

country.description: Indicates in which country the WLAN APs are located (in case cell data is not present in radio_observations)

gps.description:
Optionally supply this to improve HERE Tracking's positioning service by
contributing the scan data along with a GPS position.

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

bcch.description: Broadcast Control Channel (Synonymous to ARFCN = Absolute Radio Frequency Channel) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bsic).

bsic.description: Base Station Identity Code (for instance, color code) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bcch).

cid.description: Cell Identifier, 16 bits. Mcc+mnc+lac+cid uniquely identifies the GSM cell.

system.description:
Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

This object can be read by HERE Tracking whereas the content of the payload is
opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

homenetwork.description: Information about subscriber home network - 3GPP MCC+MNC or 3GPP2 SID+NID. Dual-SIM devices can provide information on both two subscriptions.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

This describes when the reported measurements were taken.

If the device does not provide a timestamp, Here Tracking writes its own system time
here at ingestion time.

transition.description:
| Transition Type          | Meaning                                  |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------- |
| PING_OUTSIDE_FENCE       | The device has transitioned fully outside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_IN_FENCE            | The device has transitioned fully inside the geofence. The accuracy circle does not intersect the geofence anywhere |
| PING_NEAR_FENCE_BOUNDARY | The accuracy circle intersects the geofence. |

trackingId.description: The ID HERE Tracking assigned to the device when it was claimed by a user.

type.description: The type of notification channel to be created

url.description: Required for type webhook. A URL for webhook notifications capable of receiving POST requests.
A URL for webhook notifications capable of receiving POST requests
